description_text:

Sem

conversations.body_text: Hi Sam Fonseka，    You can slightly loosen the four screws on the cover on the “S” side of the VAM Pro, then remove the motor and inspect it. Please check whether the washer inside has shifted. You can reposition it properly, or take a photo and send it to me for confirmation. After that, reinstall the motor — in many cases, this will restore normal operation.  If the issue is still not resolved after this, we will send you a replacement VAM Pro.

Hi there,

I opened up the case and repositioned the washer, unfortunately it hasn't
fixed the issue.

Thanks,

Sem
